main event: A bright orange object was observed moving at high speed across the sky in Dallas, Texas on August 4, 1955.
interesting points: The object moved faster than any aircraft the observer had ever seen.
The object crossed half the sky in 10-15 seconds before disappearing.
No sound or trail was noted, and the object wasn't bright enough to be seen clearly.
The report states the data is characteristic of a meteor, but no trail or tail was reported.
The duration and degree of arc the object passed through rules out explanations like a satellite, balloon, or aircraft.
